txt.en:
'With that yellow dwarf-lamp, you can see the dwarf-doors hidden around Zelem-melek. This is good for you because we dwarves hid many things behind secret doors that can only be seen by the light of dwarf-lamps. Zurr-tharûkh is one such place.

'Zurr-tharûkh was a tomb where some of the most honoured warriors of Khazad-dûm were interred. Some of my own forefathers are there, in fact. The thought that Mazog and his ilk may have entered such a place brings a knot to my gut. But before I can ask you to aid me in reclaiming it, you first must find it.

'Head west, but stop within the halls of Mudmul-charâf. Look somewhere to the north, and the door to Zurr-tharûkh should reveal itself to you.'

'I am impressed you were able to locate Zurr-tharûkh. Even I, one whose forebears are buried within, had to walk by that section of wall several times before I saw the outline. Now, about what is inside....'
'To think, I may be reunited with some of my forefathers, heroes of Khazad-dûm. What an honour for such a lowly dwarf.'
Geirfast rebuilt an ancient yellow dwarf-lamp for you. He told you that this lamp will show you a hidden dwarf-door in Zelem-melek.
Found the dwarf-door entrance to Zurr-tharûkh
Find the dwarf-door entrance to Zurr-tharûkh

Zurr-tharûkh, hidden behind a dwarf-door, is said to be somehwere within the halls of Mudmul-charâf, west of the Twenty-first Hall.\n\nZurr-tharûkh is a tomb where some of Khazad-dûm's finest warriors were interred. Káti was able to tell you its general location, but left finding its entrance up to you.
Talk to Káti at the Twenty-first Hall
Káti is in the Twenty-first Hall, east of Zurr-tharûkh.\n\nKáti will be pleased to hear you found the hidden dwarf-door entrance to Zurr-tharûkh.
